Comments_List: I gained knowledge about presenting in a professional setting, both from watching others and from having the opportunity to present myself.

I didn't used to mind them, but some (not all) of the loosely affiliated or unaffiliated people are bothering me more and more. The ethic of being open to the public is right, but I wonder what speakers think of Yale when they field perplexingly off-base questions from people who look like professors from other departments.
Variety of speakers. I learned to most from the comments of the faculty and students.
The workshop is an important tool of professional socialization.
